website_summaries.verdict: The AfterShokz Trekz Air is a very likable sports headphone, particularly for people who want a secure fitting headphone that doesn't cover or prod their ears.
pros: The AfterShokz Trekz Air is a slimmed down bone-conduction headphone that offers improved sound and is very comfortable to wear, leaving your ears open to hear the outside world
It works well as a headset for making cell-phone call and comes with a nice carrying pouch
cons: While the sound quality is improved, it's still not as good as what you'd get from a comparably priced "traditional" headphone

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are the perfect solution to my hearing problems as they bypass the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have perforated my right eardrum twice and my left once while serving over seas in a combat zone. These headphones are the perfect solution to my hearing problems as they bypass the ear canals. The bone conduction is fantastic, and I would not give these up for anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie P

customer_reviews.title: Terrible audio quality. For anti-audiophiles
customer_reviews.text: I may be biased because I work in professions audio, but these were a huge disappointment. I’ve seen bone conduction headphones in the media with terrible reviews, and decided to take the plunge on the AfterShokz, upon seeing a decent star rating. The sound quality was like holding your phone speaker up next to your ear. I went on a five mile run to the gym, and couldn’t discern any of the lyrics to what I was listening to. At the gym, I had to have the volume all the way up which, IS audible to the people around you. This is the first thing I’ve returned to Amazon after two hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: Headset Contacts Press on Nerve
customer_reviews.text: Downgrading to 3 stars. After 2 weeks it just didn't turn on. Amazon refunded. - Original Review - Would have been perfect, but the contacts happen to press on a sensitive spot near both my ears and causes pain if I wear it for more than 15 minutes. So I have to wear the headset on the top of my head like normal headphones -- then move the contacts to a different spot. For the price it should have been near perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Usc

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these when I'm cycling. They are very well made with great sound but also allow me to hear whats going on around me. I would NOT get these if you plan to use them at the gym. One thing I wish they had is a indicator light letting me know when they are on/off.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Wish there was some adjustability to them.
customer_reviews.text: They work good for some applications. If you wear them at the gym you'll need earplugs. I just went back to my standard earbuds for the gym. for on the street walking the dog or riding the bike they are great ! Able to hear what's going on around you. They can make your ears itch or tickle on higher volumes due to the vibration. The Ridgid band sticks out several inches from the back of my head and when I tilt them down to my neck (so I can wear a hoody) it takes them out of position for optimal placement for sound quality. Everybody has a different size head, ear placement so having some adjustability is key.
customer_reviews.author: Toby J. Thew

customer_reviews.title: Comfort A+, sound compared to originals F
customer_reviews.text: These totally solve the comfort issues from the originals. However, it seems to come at the expense of sound quality and volume. The originals: when I put in earplugs they would get louder. New ones: not at all. Originals: when I would press them into my ear to really hear a good jam, they would get louder and richer, almost as good as in-ear phones. New ones: no louder and they get tinny sounding. Originals: overall volume much louder. New ones: Perry weak. Such a huge disappointment. Why they are not exactly the same sound, with just a more comfortable setup, I don't understand. Maybe I got a set of counterfeits?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They were good until they weren't
customer_reviews.text: Definitely one of those times I should have paid more attention to the one star reviews. Really liked these for about a month. Used them for probably 10 runs or so. Got ready to go on a run yesterday. They won't turn on. They won't take a charge. They are now completely useless. I'll be contacting the seller, but I have to say I'm not optimistic. Naturally, this happens 35 days after they were delivered. Live and learn, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Roy B.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last December. After 7 months, it broke, cannot connection, charge, turn on, anything. I filed a warranty claim, and returned the defective product according to the AfterShokz guys. However, after they received my return last month, those guys keep telling me the replacement will be shipped within 1-2 business day until now, but never ship it. Different people told me different stories about my replacement. Do not spend $100+ on this trash and the horrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had these for less than a week, so I’ll update if anything changes, but, so far, I absolutely love them. This technology is so great for letting you listen to audio input and use your ears for sound around you. I drive over the road for a living and want to be able to keep my ears open while enjoying music during the long hours behind the wheel. So far, these seem perfect. I had read not to expect the same sound quality with this tech as traditional head phones, especially the over-the-ear variety, so I went in with very low expectations but was surprised to find the quality was better than I had hoped for!
customer_reviews.author: TrevorG

customer_reviews.title: Overall great, UI alerts/messages TOO LOUD - volume can't be controlled.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these since late May and am using them for marathon training (5 days a week). Overall they are great, but I really HATE how loud the interface sounds are. Alerts/messages are jarringly loud and their volume CAN'T be adjusted - a major weakness. Minimally one star off for this, perhaps more. Sad to read the same criticism on the follow up model, the Aeropex, so apparently this has not been addressed (there were complaints about this issue on the AfterShokz support forums too). Otherwise, I'd recommend them for active people on the roads (runners, cyclists, ...) who need to have situational awareness. Sound quality is fine for a portable Bluetooth headset designed for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These really work!
customer_reviews.text: These are very cool and work like they say. I use them for bike riding so I can listen to music/podcasts but still hear cars/traffic. I cannot believe how well these work and the sound quality is fantastic. They say if you don't believe these are bone conducting then put your fingers in your ears, I did and the sound didn't change at all. Totally worth it for someone that wants to hear music while doing something that requires you to still hear your environment. Battery has been good so far have taken them on 3+ hour bike rides and they haven't died. Very light, and they are a soft rubbery plastic so they feel nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas S.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 3, quality an issue
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 pair of these. Quality was an issue. In one pair the left sound volume was quite a bit less. That pair also fell apart after a few hours of use. In one pair the sound volume was less on the right side. One pair worked perfectly. Great product concept and I have had wired versions of this brand before and have had no quality issues with those. I keep a pair in each bag I take (work, volunteer, lunch, exercise) so I can listen to my audio-books and be aware of my surroundings.
customer_reviews.author: Living Life In The Midwest

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones ever.
customer_reviews.text: I will start off this review with the fact I am totally deaf in my right ear due to a tumor I had removed that also took my acoustic nerve. I am a candidate for a BAHA hearing devise that is basically the same technology of these headphones. I actually can sense stereo sound with these. It is also great as it does not block out ambient sounds since you are not putting anything in your ears. This is important for me as I where these while riding my bicycle and need to hear others calling to pass me on the trail. The quality of the sound is rich. Glad I found these.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth headset with open ear functionality
customer_reviews.text: Very unique product that works incredibly well. I've used them for about 2 weeks now and they function beautifully, have a decent microphone for hands free driving and sound amazing given they aren't seated in the ear canal. My only complaint is where they sit against my head, the plastic feels sharp at times and presses uncomfortably if I wear them too long. Id still buy them again and appreciate the open ear function enough for driving to tell all my friends about them.
customer_reviews.author: Raine Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones until they don't hold their form against your head anymore
customer_reviews.text: I have loved my AfterShokz headphones. I have used them almost every day since I received them back in November 2018. The problem is that after extended use the headphones don't stay form fitting to you head and they basically become useless. So far I can't find any warranty details, seems the seller is no longer on Amazon and so if I bought another pair that makes these headphones cost about $300/year compared to the Bose headphones I paid $350 for, but they lasted 8 years or a little more than $40/year.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable with good sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Just for the record, I wear these along with my perscription glasses and bicycle helmet and I haven't had any problems, it is perfectly comfortable. I got this to maintain situational awareness but still listen to music when exercising around town. Works perfectly. At first I kind of doubted it was actually 'bone conductive' but listening to it with earplugs in let me know it is. The sound quality is surprisingly good, especially the bass. Not much worse quality than a pair of earbuds for around the same price. If it is important you hear what is going on around you, this is a great purchase, I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Cashman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound, considering they're not even in my ears!
customer_reviews.text: I ride my bike to work sometimes, so I really want to be able to hear cars coming up behind me, but I also want to listen to music. These are perfect for that. The sound quality is at least as good as any of my ear buds, and I still have not charged the battery after using them sporadically for over a month! The Bluetooth is excellent - never cuts out like another pair of Bluetooth earbuds I had a few years ago. Another good thing is that it doesn't go into your ear canal, so there's no concern about fit - I have small ear canals, so it can be a challenge to find comfy earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: I got a pair of these for myself and my boyfriend for an upcoming trip. These headphones are so cool! I hate earbud because they are so uncomfortable and you can not hear anything else going on around you. The aftershocks are super comfortable to wear and you can still hear the world around you. My boyfriend wears them in the office and it allows him to focus and listen to music and still hear when he needs to answer the phone. The battery lasts him all day at work (pauses off and on all day). These are definitely a quality of life upgrade. I know a few folks that may get these for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing if practical is what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.text: The most practical and comfortable headphones I've ever owned. I use them for running, walking my dog, and whenever I need to be aware my surroundings. They obviously aren't the best headphones for every scenario, but they serve their purpose. Having these as an option is quite literally a life saver. They stay on my head very well. I can vigorously shake my head and they don't move in the slightest, but they also aren't too tight either. For me, even the largest in-the-ear headphones fall out of my ears while I'm running and sweating, but these stay on. Im training for a marathon and these stay on my head for the duration of my long runs with no adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Branden Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had much chance to use these, though haven't ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had much chance to use these, though haven't had any issues in the short time I have had them. Got much more time than the 6 hour expected battery life from full charge. (still had 30% after 8 hours continued use.)
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Buy New, used might not come with all necessary peices
customer_reviews.text: I bought them used because the description said charger base may be missing when in truth the ear plugs are missing. The ear plugs would definitely make these more enjoyable now I'm stuck having to buy a seperate pair of ear plugs. This is the second time on two different products where the description has been wrong and the price isn't fair for the defect. I plugged my ears using my fingers and, the sound is amazing. I can really feel that bass!! Just have to find the right ear plugs now; sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good for their specific purpose
customer_reviews.text: These are not headphones for audiophiles, and they are not headphones to wear on an airplane or in a library. If your use case falls into one of those categories, you will be sorely disappointed. However, if you use these for athletic purposes, especially if you are biking or running on crowded trails, these will make a huge difference in your quality of life. They allow you to hear your music without blocking out nearby sounds, which means you retain situational awareness.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: AfterShokz Stopped working after 35 days
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have had in less than 6 months. Latest one, stopped working, blue light will not turn off and cannot turn the unit on/off. When I try to charge it, it will turn on, but then just keep cycling thru on, off, and trying to pair, then just stops and won't do anything. $150 is a lot to spend on something that stops working after 30 days. I also sent an email to AfterShokz, and absolutely no response.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Kohlrus

customer_reviews.title: the best (for me)
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many headphones but I loved this the most because it doesn't hurt the ears at all as it doesn't go inside the ears, so I can hear the music for hours without my ear get hurt. it allow you to hear the environment around you, so it's suitable during cycling , running, walking , running on the streets or you need to interact with others same time you listen to music. maybe it doesn't suite you if you consider only a rich , a high base sound, and a total isolation from the environment , if so, don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Al Badr

customer_reviews.title: Don’t know how I lived without this
customer_reviews.text: I’m on phone a lot. With this I can continue to do my work or chores around house as both hands are now free. Plus the caller is not disturbed by the noise I’m making. Calls are clear music is clear. They are light weight and not as tight as some I’ve tried that felt like they were squeezing my head. If volume is up to high they do vibrate and tickle but normal volume is fine. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Maag

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good sound and battery life, ears stay open to your surroundings
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical as to whether these would really be what I was looking for, but I was very pleasantly surprised. I love the open-ear feel and effect! The sound is not as good as with in-the-ear earphones (how could it possibly be?), but it is quite good nonetheless. The microphone works well, and I use these all day at work taking calls.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: I love these things!
customer_reviews.text: I am an inveterate walker that has always had trouble with earbuds, both because they make my ears itchy and also because I like to be aware of cars, bicycles, etc. in my surroundings. Before I purchased these, I was concerned about the quality of sound -- not really a problem, as least for me -- plenty good enough at least for the kind of music I've got on my playlists. Moreover, they are really easy to set up -- getting them connected to my iPhone was easy and fast. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DkPond

customer_reviews.title: the minute the warranty expires they will stop working!
customer_reviews.text: this is the second pair of aftershokz i have purchased. both pairs have "mysteriously" just stopped turning on immediately once the warranty expired. also the square trade protection plan they offer to extend that warranty doesn't work as they will just run you in circles and claim its not an item they support
customer_reviews.author: bradleh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I have complete deafness in one ear. This allows me to listen to music, or a movie, in stereo again. Wonderful. I had hoped to also use it as a hearing assistance device when teaching. There are smartphone apps that turn the phone into a microphone that transmits to the headset. This does NOT work. There is a brief bluetooth lag that creates an echo effect when the speaker is close enough to hear.
customer_reviews.author: Gajab

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones!!! I usual charge them while I’m asleep but the battery last almost two days. I listen to a lot of music though so sometimes it doesn’t last as long. Very comfortable and great quality. You should never have them super loud. If you only want to hear the music just put in the fome earbuds that come with it. I got a hard case for them since they’re so expensive. I would recommend others doing the same. Though the price is high it’s worth it. Before I was always replacing earbuds but now I have these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My New Favorite Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like writing reviews for stuff, but I have to for this. I absolutely love these headphones. I wear them everywhere and anywhere. They work better than advertised and I’ve already recommended these to all my friends and family. The sound is great, and I can hear what’s going on around me. Not to mention that they are so comfortable that I forget that I’m wearing them all the time. Thank you for this wonderful product, keep up the good work!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Vaghi

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for outdoor exercise
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for those who want to listen to music while walking, running, cycling, or any other outdoor activity while still maintaining awareness of your surroundings. At a low to moderate volume I can carry on a conversation; even at higher volumes, I can still hear vehicles approaching. Very clear sound, better than I expected from bone conduction. I get about 6 hours of play on a full charge. Super comfortable as well, even with hat and glasses. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Update: Customer service was responsive and helpful in honoring the warranty. Hopefully this new pair lasts. The turnaround was delayed a little due to volume from the holidays. ___________________ Pro: Easy to connect to my Android phone and iPad. Battery lasted for many hours. Con: Stopped working after maybe 20 uses. Won't charge of turn on. Currently waiting to hear back from the company about the warranty replacement. Will update review based on how accommodating and pleasant their customer service is (add or removed stars). Overall: How can a pricey headphone stop working after 2 months of ownership and very little use. Disappointed by that.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Mathieu

customer_reviews.title: They really work!
customer_reviews.text: Great for mowing the lawn, Put the AfterShokz Trekz Air Open Ear Wireless Bone Conduction Headphones on along with earplugs in your ears and you are all set. Connect to audio on your cellphone, great sound quality and when you receive a call, audio stops and you hear the phone ring. Shut the mower off and take the call, right through the headset. You will never miss hearing the phone ring!
customer_reviews.author: TumbleWeed

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: These are truly a life changer for me. I used to run in headphones that wouldn’t allow me to hear the outside which was dangerous especially when running on roads or bike paths. I switched to running without headphones but then I started using the AirPods Pro which have a transparency feature. Those were great but would fall out of my ears when I got really sweaty on hot days and long runs. These are absolutely amazing as I can hear my music and the outside noise and I don’t have to worry about them falling out of my ears I wish I would’ve bought these a looooong time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: For people who have sensitive ears, hate wearing and earpiece in your ear all day, or need to hear your surroundings while making calls or listening to music, these are great! Light weight, comfortable, good sound quality and battery life. Getting used to phone notifications is a little strange though, as it sounds like it's coming from the center of your head, lol
customer_reviews.author: Devin C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have a hearing loss in both ears and wear a hearing aid in both. It is hard to find a headset that will work over hearing aids. This one works in front of the ear through the bone. I am amazed at how well this works for me. If you have good ears it should be sooooo much better. I am very, very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maestro

customer_reviews.title: Too big for small heads
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are very different from the ear plug type. There is no noise cancelling - difficult to use in the gym. I'm a petite woman and it was too big for my head There is no measurement of head size. There is no way to adjust the headset to fit my head. I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DN-Michigan

customer_reviews.title: I was pissed at first
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble charging it , I mostly use it for yoga and walks (running not for me) I love these mostly because I have ears problems. Oh the charging problem was just my power supply which wasnt included I switched it out and bango they charged. Rambling aside they’re great buy them
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Best for running/exercise
customer_reviews.text: People who dislike these are using them for what seems like mostly casual use. I use them for running and these are THE best running/exercise headphones that I’ve had. I was skeptical to buy them, making sure to validate the return policy, but after a month of use, I love them. 0 complaints
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: REALLY couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: OK, it took a few days to get used to the sound. Initially I thought that it was a little (just a little) hollow, like hearing it down a small tube. After a couple of days I adjusted to it and wow. With more traditional head phones your ear is either covered or plugged and that always got uncomfortable for me very quickly. I have come to love the sound and the feel of these. At a moderate volume you can continue to have conversations and fully hear the environment around you. They have great sound even at full volume. I don't think I will ever willingly use traditional headphones or earbuds again. So so impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for music but great for podcasts
customer_reviews.text: Actually been enjoying these more than I thought I would. They are great for doing chores or when you are out and about shopping or something. Cons are that people can hear what you are listening too if the environment is very quiet and music does not sound good on these. I know people will say to use earplugs but it really doesn't make sense to use earplugs unless you are in an environment where you want to be completely isolated.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are pretty good. 7 months later though the left side stopped working. Which honestly I kind of expect with any technology, but that is why I always make sure there is a warranty. I made a warranty request to get them replaced and have had only radio silence. SUPER frustrating! It has been three weeks, I have made multiple attempts, and haven’t heard anything. I purchased these more expensive headphones verse the cheap Chinese knock offs because I wanted to receive good service. I would definitely not recommend these head phones to anyone because of the lack of customer care.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Great for podcasts and phone calls
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to listen to podcasts and take phone calls, and I love them. I don't listen to a lot of music on headphones, but gave these a try. They are fine for music, but if you're picky about music quality these and other bone conduction might leave you a little disappointed. But for podcasts and phone calls they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Martin

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: These things, are phenomenal! Love them!! I crank it when I need to drown out my coworkers, or just lowly play some classical stuff so I don't kill them!!! haha
customer_reviews.author: ineedanewaddress

customer_reviews.title: bluetooth pairing
customer_reviews.text: Great bone conduction headset. I now have two, each for its own purpose. Pairing with the bluetooth transmitter works. The problem I have is my large fingers on those small buttons. I don't know how else they could do the buttons and they do work.
customer_reviews.author: John Nicoll

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Mine Has Some Defects...
customer_reviews.text: Did research about these head phones especially since they sat out on the ear. Sound was great but after my first run the sound up/power on button stopped working for a day. I decided to try 3 attempts to charge and turn on and finally on the last attempt it worked. However, now my sound down button doesn't work from day to day. I still use the product very frequently but my confidence that all the buttons will work perfectly is dropping, not sure if I'm going to contact the vendor about this issue or just turn it back in to Amazon. Hope your experience is better then mine.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Had an AfterShokz Titanium that lasted 5 yrs so when it just died, I wanted something comparable. It's shocking how much just a 1/4 ounce less in weight, plus a less bulky designed makes a difference. I hardly notice I'm wearing it when running - no bouncing around. Starts up much quicker than the Titanium. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Fray

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: The AfterShokz Trekz Air bone conduction headphones are great. I use them while riding my bicycle and even with the wind blowing I can hear from the headphones fine. And I never have to worry about any earphones falling out of my ears which always happened on standard earbud type earphone sets.
customer_reviews.author: Dale B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice work out head set
customer_reviews.text: I have had this headset for several months. Ideal for outdoor use when exercising because I still want to hear everything going on around me. I have got these wet with sweat repeatedly and they are fine. A really nice change from ear buds sound quality is very good but probably bass is a little down from others that sit in your ear.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Alabran

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasts 10 hours
customer_reviews.text: I use these at work since we can't have In-Ear headphones while working a 10-hour shift. I have them playing music the whole time and at the end of the shift, they are still ant 20%. They fit snuggly and work great.
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 9 months and it's dead. It wasn't dropped or crushed. Worst case, it got damp from sweat. I've tried numerous cables and power points but it's not charging. Very disappointing given the price. There is no return or warranty options
customer_reviews.author: Avid Runner

customer_reviews.title: Reliable everyday headphone with endless battery.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this headphone. I use it mainly at work or at the bus or even while driving my car. The bass is not surprising, but hey, it's a bone conduction headphone. Even though, the sound quality is amazing. I tried using it for gaming but the sound quality was crap. But I am certain it's not about the headphone itself but my bluetooth drivers in my pc. Regarding the battery, I always forget to turn the phone off. But what I like about it is that it doesn't waste any battery if you're not using it while it's on. Kudos to who created this battery efficiency.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on these type of headphones and am glad I chose this one. I use it on my road bike. It allows me to hear other road sounds and can still listen to music. The sound quality is great, even though it doesn't go directly into the ear canal. It works better than expected. I have used it a half a dozen times, but time will tell for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: mwill

customer_reviews.title: I liked them until I had to return them
customer_reviews.text: First, this headset was awesome! Sound was good and if someone was trying to talk to you, you could hear them too. My favorite part was not having an earbud stuck in my ear. I have earbuds but can only tolerate them for about an hour and then they have to come out. These headphones I can wear all day and I used them almost daily until they stopped turning on. I don't know what happened, but Amazon took them back and as soon as I get a refund I'll reorder and try again. Pray for me and the success of my next pair. 5 starts for now.....
customer_reviews.author: Josh B

customer_reviews.title: meh, definitely not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: First of all, they lose a star for not turning off automatically. Call me lazy but everything else these days will turn off automatically so you don't find the battery drained when you want to use them. I wasn't impressed with the headphones overall. Maybe I was expecting too much with all the great reviews and the high price. The vibrating on my head gets a bit irritating fairly quickly so I can't really use them for very long. And since everybody around me can hear it as well, it kind of defeats the purpose of using headphones. Definitely not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: rewardsu

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: These are not meant to be noise cancelling or super high fidelity. They are meant to work outside your ear, so you can do activities safely. I also use them for phone calls in my office and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B

customer_reviews.title: Special purpose headphones
customer_reviews.text: Pro not covers ear allowing ambient sounds through making it excellent for outdoor activities. Con City sounds make it hard to hear at times. Ok for music but phone conversations can become difficult if there are high ambient sounds around.
customer_reviews.author: Faisal Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: I like this one because you get a great sound out of the head set but you can also hear what going on around you . You don't have to worry about these falling out of you ears like buds do and you aren't isolated with sound so you can be aware of what is going on around you.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the original
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for the set that my husband had a couple years ago. This one does not make good enough contacts and is not tight enough to have a really good Fidelity and sound. It was a disappointment all around. Will be getting the old version again.
customer_reviews.author: Houkje

customer_reviews.title: Sound works great at medium volume levels, however I get a bad buzz at higher volume levels
customer_reviews.text: Worked great initially out of the box. However, after a little time I seem to be getting a buzz out of the left headphone, almost like a blown speaker, when the volume level exceeds 75%. I normally can't hear very much out of the headphones below 50% volume level. from 50 to a little less then 75% volume level it works fine. I notice it more when I have to crank up the volume for listening in on a conference call and there is a lot of background noise. I will then move that one headphone further away from my ear.
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: The last number dialed shortcut is terrible
customer_reviews.text: If you press the button on these twice it proceeds to the next track, but if you accidentally tap three times it calls the last number dialed. When working out hard, these headphones unexpectedly calling the last number dialed is the worst thing. Often people try to call me back or I have to interrupt my workout. Otherwise I really like these headphones for their sound quality and for cycling so I can hear my surroundings.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dancers!
customer_reviews.text: I dance/rehearse in a space with other dancers so we can't blast our music w/o interrupting others. I needed something to stay on with all the movement that I do. Ear buds don't work for me as they fall off all the time and are actually uncomfortable. These are the PERFECT solution to all of my needs. They don't budge at all and they are loud enough when I need them to be and I can also hear background noises just in case I need to hear something like the door opening, someone calling my name, etc. So happy to have found these!
customer_reviews.author: lsales

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and hearing aid compatible
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can wear these with my hearing aids. The sound, while not studio headphone quality, is quite adequate for the gym, and allows you to hear sounds in environment--important if you walk or bike outdoors. I do wish they were more adjustable, as they do not fit my head well when properly placed.
customer_reviews.author: K. J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I gave the noise cancelation the low rating due to the fact that these are not an inserted type earphone. However, even with background noise, these are good. I work in construction, so there are times these are hard to hear, but they operate easy and have great phone capabilities. Whether I have them on when on a job site or while driving, I can still hear what is going on around me. Music comes through with very nice quality as well. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Haas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I can't stand ear buds, I don't like cords, so these have been great for me for the past 6 months. The charge holds for about 6 hours or more. They are comfortable as well. The sound is fine. Nothing amazing, but again it doesnt sit in your ear, so it's pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Peter Casper

customer_reviews.title: Great for the purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Use them when riding my bicycle. Can still here surrounding sounds/talk to others. Not as great quality as regular earbuds but not really the point. Little quiet when riding next to very busy roads. I live in Chicago bike path along lake is next to lake shore drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable.... but they dont work two pairs same issie
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second pair ...first pair started to malfunction ...found a different color and ordered them , had to file a claim for the first pair...I guess I will use them for away exercising...PS new ones died in less than two months
customer_reviews.author: B. Green

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Well worth the $
customer_reviews.text: I wear when running and cycling. Allows me to be aware of my surroundings while enjoying music. Is not for noise canceling. Fits well, no irritation when wearing bike helmet, visor and sunglasses.
customer_reviews.author: Al Waddell

customer_reviews.title: Love these so much
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from tinnitus. I use these during the day to stream from the ReSound Relief app. They work great. Very comfortable to wear, sound quality is great. The battery lasts about 8 hours or so doing this and it recharges pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: D from Big D

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! Very, very light and sound really good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 star for 3 reasons
customer_reviews.text: 1. The quality is amazing, they dont put out a lot of bass but for something that bounces sound through a bone you cant expect them to. 2. Perfect for the shower. I work nights so when i get home at 4 am everyone is sleep. Pop in the earplugs that come with and get in the shower, sound gets a bit distorted when fully submurger (washing your hair) but return to normal when they come out. 3. I wear these to work with a hat over them and nobody suspects a thing until i show them. Great product, must buy. Very sturdy and can hear everything around you.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for running without the danger of not being able to hear
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these! Well worth the price. Sound quality is great. Bluetooth quality for phone calls is good too. Awesome for running with music but also allows for open ear so you dont have to worry about hearing. I can still hear birds chirping and squirrels running in the woods. Highly reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Walton

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing High Fidelity Music 🎶
customer_reviews.text: I have had these conductive headphones for over a year now and I have to say these have changed my life. I like that when I work outside I am able to listen to music while being aware of my surroundings. I started just wearing them working out, and now wear them all day long jamming to the Dead. The quality of the sound is unbelievable and the usuability of the mic in conjunction with Siri is flawless. If you are looking for the cutting edge of high fidelity music then these are the headphones for you!
customer_reviews.author: sean ogilvie

customer_reviews.title: Safety
customer_reviews.text: What I love most about these headphones is the ability to wear them without the earplugs so I can hear surrounding noises. I live/work/play in a dangerous environment and these headphones let me listen to my music and talk to my co-workers, wife, children or hear cars approaching, badgers rustling in the leave piles, skunks cocked and loaded waiting for me to run by and so forth.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Great for long workouts, sound is the same as earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband who is a triathlete. He likes them as they are more comfortable than having earbuds in his ears on a long run or bike ride, but he said the sound isn't a huge difference and he needs to have the volume up pretty high to be able to hear the music over the ambient sound, which defeats the purpose. He does wear them for the comfort factor and enjoys them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for road runs and work!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for road runs and anywhere you want to hear things around you. If you are in a noisy area just put in earplugs and the sound is incredible. I use them at work more than I do running. The battery lasts more than the 6 hours they advertise but I don’t keep them turned loud the whole time. Highly recommend especially for the Amazon price and shipping speed.
customer_reviews.author: Audie M.

customer_reviews.title: Is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Excellent , great battery life! Charges very quickly and ready to operate. I’m able to reposition them easily when i lay down on my pillow. Great outdoors for phone calls, A few said my audio was low. Speaking slightly louder helped. Comfortable as wearing sunglasses, they don’t interfere with them simultaneously. Just got my son a pair for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: FrankMarcellino

customer_reviews.title: A great investment
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best investments yet, almost no bleed unless the volume is max. I wear this everywhere, not many people notice it, or question it. Sound quality is pretty fine, you won't notice small details, but it makes that up by having you aware of your surroundings. Once you wear it often enough, you won't even notice that it is there.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Works great, amazing sound. I am able to hear cars and people talking around me. Not comfortable for long periods of time as they rest on your ears. I make it through an hour long run but any longer they get uncomfortable—-again the sound is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly weiss

customer_reviews.title: Pairing it to two devices doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I bought it was to pair it to two devices as it claimed it did, and it did at first and then it stopped and matter what I did, I could never pair it to two devices again and I had it for a few days so I really REALLY tried.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Maralason

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use when I ride my ebike. I have a p;air of quiet comfort bose noise canceling earbuds that are excellent for when I ride my motorcycle, but they had too much wind noise on the bicycle. So I tired the Treks Air and they worked perfect. I like them so much that I leave them on a lot of the time when I am not out riding. They are light weight and very comfortable and work well with eye glasses. A great product and glad I have them.
customer_reviews.author: L. V. C.

customer_reviews.title: They do what what they say they do.
customer_reviews.text: I grabbed Aftershokz Titanium because my normal outdoor running route is along side a rural road and I wanted to be aware of traffic. I wanted to be aware of my environment. For that purpose these headphones are great. I hear everything around me, they are lightweight, and comfortable. The sound isn't superb for music, but perfect for books and podcasts. So 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones around!
customer_reviews.text: I could not love these more! I love not having a wire attached to me and the sound is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Cybill

customer_reviews.title: Great for listening to music and not isolating yourself.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Love that I can hear my music and the rest of the world. I do think it cuts out every once in a while when I move my head.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Trimble

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Not meant for noise cancelling. I rxcrllebt sound and you can still hear your surroundings! Work exactly how they were meant to
customer_reviews.author: mack

customer_reviews.title: Better than Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a long time user of different higher end sports headphones. I never found one that worked from a fit standpoint until I got the Trekz Air Open. I was a little skeptical but after using this for my general workout, spin class and runs I am ecstatic. The fit is great and it does not require constant correction like my other "in the ear" models". As a bonus I was able to use this while mountain biking and still be able to hear and have a conversation with other riders and hikers while enjoying music in the background.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wartenberg

customer_reviews.title: My favorite headphones, I'll never go back to wires
customer_reviews.text: Nice to wear, keeps my ears open to hear everything around me while biking. mic works great. It just struggles mightily to connect and disconnect to more than one device. I like to use it with my PC and my cell phone but it will not connect to multiple devices at the same time and requires a power cycle and turning off bluetooth to switch devices if you want to change from talking on your PC to your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Device failed within a month
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works as intended. Music without blocking your hearing of surroundings. Unfortunately, mine failed within a month. It just failed to start.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Tan

customer_reviews.title: Good for conductive hearing loss
customer_reviews.text: I have conductive hearing loss in both my ears. This thing bypasses the ear drum. My auditory nerve works fine and this gets sound to it. Rather remarkable invention. Good price. For me -- great value. Cheers to the engineers who figured this out; good on you, mates!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K.

customer_reviews.title: Grreat product! Must try for headphone enthusiests.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way you can listen to speech output from consumer electronic products and the ambient environment sounds at the same time. I would give the product 6 stars if possible if it had an adjustable headband, since the rear headband protrudes from the back of the head for me; I have a relatively small head and cannot rest the back of my head flush on sofas with head rests.
customer_reviews.author: kiwiman

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for, but good for what they are.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, I bought because I am really hard of hearing. Don't have any complaints but they dont work all that well for my hearing loss. My wife said they work well. The speaker is right there next to your ear but definitely not bone conductivity, just a great location so your ear isn't covered
customer_reviews.author: mestonm

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones for out dor running. You can hear birds and all around when you listen music.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound
customer_reviews.text: Best Sound I've heard for a bone conduction open ear head phone (I have two)
customer_reviews.author: Larry Moonan

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for runners, not audiophiles
customer_reviews.text: These aren't normal headphones. You're not going to get amazing sound out of them. They're made so you can still hear your surroundings. That said these still blew me away with sound quality and how loud they get.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight L Munson

customer_reviews.title: Tired of headphones IN your ears?
customer_reviews.text: First headset that doesn't fall out/off or give me a headache. Am able to hear what's going on around me while on a call or listening to music. Want noise canceling for that annoying flight or the full effect of that song you are listening to? ... add the included ear plugs! Great battery life and connects to two devices at the same time as a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for people who hate earbuds
customer_reviews.text: My husband detests earbuds and these make listening to music and audio books so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: pkbemmes

customer_reviews.title: Best for exercise
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned beats and Bose but never liked them for working out. These are what I have been looking for. Best pair of headphones, yet. Only issue is the charge port is so hard to get to that I have to use my teeth to open. Oh well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tin can
customer_reviews.text: Sounds like a tin can, bass sound is very poor. Also, the back part protrudes a lot.
customer_reviews.author: mrgel

customer_reviews.title: Good for jogging outdoors, not so much at the gym.
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months the first pair I bought had an issue with the battery, but the company was good enough to switch them out. I found they are good outdoors, but bad at the gym. It is hard to hear when there is loud noise around. They stick great on my head though. I had my wife try them on and she has the same experience.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Mendez

product_meta.title: AfterShokz Air Open Ear Wireless Bone Conduction Headphones, Slate Grey, AS650SG
feature_bullets: Bone conduction technology and open Fit design delivers music through your cheekbones, ensuring ears remain completely open to ambient sounds for maximum situational awareness during long-term wear.
The new, organic, wraparound design is 20% lighter than its counterpart to deliver a flexible fit for unnoticeable all-day comfort and stability.
Bluetooth V4.2 connectivity and convenient multipoint pairing compatible with your iOS and Android Bluetooth-ready smartphones or tablets and Mac and PC computers and laptops.
Premium pitch plus guarantees a Premium audio experience, including wide dynamic range and rich bass.Frequency response:20Hz~20KHz
Enjoy six hours of continuous music + calls on a single charge, or 20 days of standby time. Charges in 2 hours.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,630 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #333 in Over-Ear Headphones#820 in Earbud & In-Ear Headphones
